articles.title: GOP committee uses AI video of Schumer to blame Dems for shutdown
articles.author: Ryan Mancini
articles.summary: The National Republican Senatorial Committee shared an AI-generated video of Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) praising the government shutdown. AI videos have been a tool used during the standoff between Democrats and Republicans over the funding lapse since before the shutdown began. California Gov. Gavin Newsom has also used AI to troll the Trump administration.

articles.summary: As AI capabilities accelerate, cybersecurity and privacy experts warn that the same models can infer identities, reassemble stripped-out details, and expose sensitive information. Ad Fontes Media is engaging with Advertiser to analyze its content. If you find an article you think falls short of the standard, please submit the link through this form.

articles.title: How Companies Can Get An Edge In Finance With AI
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is changing finance in a big way. Firms are trying to get a competitive edge and keep it. Forbes CCO Randall Lane interviewed a panel on the topic. Rishi Nair of Diddo, David Cushman of HFS, and Orby CEO Bella Liu discussed how things are changing and what strategies will win the day.

articles.title: AI startups are leasing luxury apartments in San Francisco for staff and offering large rent stipends to attract talent
articles.author: Fortune
articles.summary: Roy Lee, CEO of AI tech startup Cluely, has leased eight apartments for his employees in a recently-built luxury complex situated just a one-minute walk away from the office. The rents in the 16-story building in San Francisco are expensive.

articles.title: HSBC: NVIDIA's (NVDA) AI GPU Market to Keep Expanding Beyond Hyperscalers
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: HSBC analyst Frank Lee upgraded the stock to Buy from Hold and raised the target price to $320 per share from $200. The firm believes that the AI GPU total addressable market will keep expanding beyond hyperscalers, driving continuous earnings growth for Nvidia.

articles.title: HSBC Lifts AMD Price Target to $310 on OpenAI Deal Visibility
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: HSBC analyst Frank Lee raised his price target on the stock to $310 from $185 and reaffirmed his Buy rating. HSBC believes that AMD's OpenAI deal is poised to bring massive AI revenue upside potential. The companies agreed last week that OpenAI will deploy six gigawatts of AMD GPUs over several years. The deployment of the first 1 gigawatt AMD Instinct MI450 GPUs will begin in the second half of 2026. The total revenue opportunity for AMD from this deal is around $80 billion.

articles.title: HSBC Lifts AMD Price Target to $310 on OpenAI Deal Visibility

The deployment of the first 1 gigawatt AMD Instinct MI450 GPUs will begin in the second half of 2026.

On October 14, UBS lowered its price target on the stock to $1,075.00 and maintained a Buy rating. The rating comes ahead of the company's third-quarter earnings report on October 29th.

articles.title: 50 Hilarious Posts That Will Make You Giggle
articles.author: Hannah Marder
articles.summary: There are some funny tweets on Tumblr. The tags are the best part of Tumblr. One of the best tweets of all time is about Liam Neeson communicating with horses. Another one is about a bank employee who wants to say hi to a lonely man.

articles.title: Disable WhatsApp AI: Privacy & Control Explained
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: WhatsApp's launch of Meta AI hasn't been universally welcomed. The future of AI lies in proactive AI that offers personalized recommendations, automating tasks, and providing real-time assistance without prompting. Platforms like WhatsApp, Messenger and WeChat are uniquely positioned to become central hubs for this new generation of AI.

articles.title: Every Actor Who Voiced Knight Rider's Turbo-Charged Star KITT
articles.author: Adam Levine
articles.summary: Jim Ward, Val Kilmer, William Daniels and William Daniels are some of the famous actors who have lent their voices to KITT, the fictional car from "Knight Rider" TV series. Jim Ward voiced KITT in a 1984 episode of the TV sitcom "Diff'rent Strokes." Kilmer played Tom "Iceman" Kazansky in 1986's "Top Gun" and played Batman in 1995's "Batman Forever"

articles.title: Thread by @lithos_graphein on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: The PAS 5500 platform put ASML on the map back in the early 1990s. The TWINSCAN XT platform was the first dual-wafer stage platform. The scanner platform is the basic frame of the tool and how it operates. Overlay is how accurately the scanner can place circuit patterns on top of each other. The more exposures per hour the machine can do, the better the ROI on the machine.

articles.title: Google Nano Banana AI may be coming to Google Messages and here's what makes it a 'Big Deal'
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Google's 'Nano Banana' image editing AI tool has been making quite waves following its successful integration into Google Search's AI Mode and Google Lens. It is celebrated for its ability to maintain likeness in AI-generated images. Google is planning to launch it in the near future.

articles.author: Web Pro News
articles.summary: Google CEO Sundar Pichai revealed that the rapid launch of OpenAI's ChatGPT in late 2022 forced a reevaluation of the company's AI deployment strategy. Google had been a pioneer in AI technologies, but the new technology caught them off guard.

AMD's recent partnership with OpenAI shows it is well positioned to benefit from increasing competition among the leading model makers. Artificial intelligence represents a major opportunity for businesses across industries to develop products faster and cheaper than ever before.

articles.title: Cybersecurity firms raise the game as hackers leverage AI to launch more sophisticated attacks
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: Malicious actors are increasingly leveraging AI to launch more sophisticated, adaptive, and unpredictable attacks. These technologies underline the commitment to safeguarding AI ecosystems and ensuring data integrity, according to the company.  Â     .   i   in the company's website.

articles.title: Wikipedia says traffic is falling due to AI search summaries and social video
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Wikipedia's human pageviews are down 8% year-over-year, according to Marshall Miller of the Wikimedia Foundation. He points to the impact of AI and social media on how people seek information. Wikipedia even experimented with AI summaries, but it was stopped after editors complained.

articles.title: 5 Best Photo Enhancer Apps for iPhone and Android
articles.author: BI Africa
articles.summary: Artguru, Picsart, Remini and Pixelcut are some of the best photo enhancer apps for iPhone and Android. They help you to improve the quality of your photos without the need for manual editing. Remini takes old, blurry, or damaged photos and makes them high-definition in one tap.

articles.title: Japan Calls on Openai to Protect Anime Copyrights
articles.summary: The Japanese government has ordered OpenAI to refrain from any future copyright infringements related to anime, manga, and video games. On October 1, 2025, OpenAI launched the new AI video generator Sora 2. It is capable of generating short videos based on user-specified text.

articles.title: AI Startup WellTheory Raises $14 Million From General Catalyst, Accel, 7wire Ventures To Transform Autoimmune Health For Millions Of Patients
articles.author: Paula Tudoran
articles.summary: WellTheory has raised $14 million in Series A funding from General Catalyst, 7wire Ventures, Ingeborg Investments, Accel, Box Group, and Up2 Opportunity Fund. The company's mission is to "reimagine autoimmune care from the ground up" through holistic, personalized programs that address the root causes of each patient's symptoms rather than treating them in isolation. WellTheory treats patients with over 100 distinct autoimmune diagnoses using personalized care plans that adapt to each member's symptoms and root causes, tailoring treatment to individual symptoms.

articles.title: Kristen Kniep Talks AI to Alan Stock
articles.summary: Kristen Kniep and Alan Stock discuss AI with Nevada News & Views on Thursday. They discuss plans for the upcoming AI Campaign Academy, and the move from "Ask Google" to "Ask ChatGPT" on the chatbot. Alan Stock and Kristen talk about AI and how they use it.

articles.title: Smartphones with AI-Driven System-on-Chips Poised for Rapid Growth in Advancements and Applications
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: AI chips will power 35% of smartphones by 2025, according to Counterpoint Research. Apple commands 46% market share in the AI chip segment, followed by Qualcomm with 35%, and MediaTek with 12%. The most substantial growth is anticipated in the mid-range market - smartphones priced between $300 and $499.

articles.title: Week 7 NFL anytime touchdown scorer picks, odds: De'Von Achane among best bets for anytime TD scorer bets
articles.author: Owen OBrien
articles.summary: SportsLine's Machine Learning Model AI has made its top Week 7 NFL anytime picks for players like De'Von Achane and Jacory Croskey-Merritt. It's based on a model that simulates events in real-time using a computer program.

articles.title: NetSuite expands AI reach across Asia
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Amit Suxena is head of Asia for Oracle NetSuite. Artificial intelligence-driven business systems are gaining ground across Southeast Asia as companies accelerate digital transformation. He was speaking at SuiteWorld 2025 in Las Vegas, which is taking place this week.

articles.title: IndiaAI Mission, WHO to spotlight AI applications in health systems
articles.author: The Siasat Daily
articles.summary: The IndiaAI Mission in collaboration with the World Health Organization (WHO) announced a global call for abstracts highlighting impactful and scalable applications of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in health systems. Researchers, innovators and institutions from across the Global South are invited to submit their abstracts.

articles.title: How Securing a Major AI Client for 18A Chips At Intel (INTC) Has Changed Its Investment Story
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: Intel's foundry division has secured a significant artificial intelligence client for its advanced 18A/AP chip manufacturing process. Intel's outlook anticipates $58.1 billion in revenue and $5.2 billion in earnings by 2028. Some of the most optimistic analysts expected Intel's revenues to reach US$62 billion and earnings to turn positive by 20 28.

articles.title: ChatGPT latest user perk sparks controversy
articles.author: Niall Ridgley
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman announced ChatGPT's adult-only setting on X. It will be available to verified adults only. Meta is expanding Facebook Dating with an AI dating assistant in September. Dating apps are increasingly relying on AI innovations to beat their competition. Match Group and Bumble have seen a decline in value over the last four years.

articles.title: Even if it's not coming for your job, AI will likely transform it
articles.author: Amy Iverson
articles.summary: Fiverr, an online marketplace for freelance services, will lay off 30% of its workforce. Salesforce recently cut 4,000 customer support roles. Harvard Business Review cautions businesses against using AI capabilities to shed entry-level jobs for humans. The World Economic Forum suggests looking for positions that combine human judgement and AI capabilities.

articles.title: Besides English, Which Other Languages Offer Great Job Opportunities, According to Ai?
articles.summary: The global labor market is undergoing an unprecedented transformation driven by globalization, digitalization and the emergence of Artificial Intelligence. Companies are looking for profiles capable of moving fluently between cultures, markets, and languages. Languages will be one of the most decisive factors in accessing better job opportunities.

articles.title: Do We Need A Digital Driver's License For AI Access?
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: We didn't end car deaths by banning cars, but by ensuring drivers understood both their vehicles and the shared roads they traveled. Does the same logic apply to AI?    i.e. AI should be able to understand both vehicles and shared roads.

articles.title: Major BREAKTHROUGHS in AI 10X Your Productivity and Elon Musk's xAI Kills Boring Feeds FOREVER
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: There are major breakthroughs in AI across science, productivity, and social platforms. Anthropic's Claude introduces 'Skills' - text-based modules that encode best practices for tasks. Elon Musk announced a major overhaul of X's recommendation system: Grok will read every post and video and remove old heuristics.

articles.title: SSU among 30 schools chosen for freshmen AI program
articles.summary: Savannah State University is one of 30 institutions participating in the IBM SkillsBuild AI Freshmen HBCU Initiative. First-year students are required to complete the three-hour IBM course "Getting Started with Artificial Intelligence" as part of the First-Year Experience curriculum.

articles.title: San Jose Seeks Generative AI Platform for 7,000 Employees
articles.author: Web Pro News
articles.summary: San Jose is seeking proposals for a chatbot AI platform. It wants to transform how city employees handle daily tasks. It comes as San Jose is pushing the boundaries of municipal innovation in the Silicon Valley area.    .  Â    for the project.

articles.title: AI Existential Threats Amplified by 2025: Experts Urge Global Regulation
articles.author: Web Pro News
articles.summary: Isa Soares' CNN segment delved into the chilling possibilities of artificial intelligence. The report outlined scenarios where AI systems might lead to catastrophic outcomes for humanity.  iReporter Isa Soares spoke to leading AI researchers about their concerns about the future of humanity and AI.

articles.title: AI Merges with Spirituality: Chatbots Reshape Faith and Ethics
articles.author: Web Pro News
articles.summary: In an era where artificial intelligence permeates every facet of daily life, a convergence is unfolding between cutting-edge technology and ancient spiritual practices. Worshippers worldwide are increasingly turning to AI-powered tools for religious guidance, prayer assistance and even direct 'conversations' with divine entities.

articles.title: Ai Operation in the National Park Kellerwald-Edersee for the Benefit of Nature
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence collects wild stocks and data on the climate in the National Park Kellerwald-Edersee, reports its administration based in Bad Wildungen. It collects data about the climate on the wild plants and on the environment in the park.

articles.title: The Future and Credibility of Journalism Are at Risk
articles.author: Magyar Nemzet
articles.summary: Italian journalists have raised their voices against Google's AI features, which make information accessible on the homepage without users having to click through to a news portal. Google has defended its AI features in response to the criticism.   Ã‚   in a statement.

articles.title: iMini AI Integrates Tongyi Wan2.2 Animate, Ushering a New Era of AI-Powered Video Generation
articles.summary: iMini AI integrates Tongyi Wan2.2 Animate to revolutionize AI-powered video creation. It allows users to generate cinematic motion clips from a single static image. iMini AI supports both web and mobile platforms. It unites over 25 AI models, including GPT-5, Gemini 2.5 Pro, Claude 4, and Nano Banana.

articles.title: Disabling WhatsApp Meta AI Assistant on Android and iPhone Smartphones
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: WhatsApp's integration of Meta AI has sparked debate regarding user privacy and data handling. Many users are opting to disable the AI assistant due to concerns about how their data is used. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to turn off Meta AI on Android and iPhone.

articles.title: The next PC platform shift? Ed Bott on Microsoft's big Windows AI bet
articles.author: Todd Bishop
articles.summary: Ed Bott is senior contributing editor for ZDNet. Ed and GeekWire co-founder Todd Bishop discuss Microsoft's Copilot+ PC initiative and Microsoft's strategic shift to bring AI features to all Windows 11 PCs. They also discuss whether users will ever want to talk to their computers and the timing of it all as Windows 10 support comes to an end.

articles.title: Knowlify raises $3 million to redefine how people consume information
articles.author: Rumaisa Khusru
articles.summary: Knowlify, a Y Combinator S25 startup, has raised $3 million to transform the way people understand and engage with content. Its AI solution turns written content into clear, personalized explainer videos with adaptive visuals, pacing, and narration. Its current use cases span researchers simplifying dense papers, textbook publishers helping students grasp difficult concepts, universities cutting production costs by 90%, and corporations keeping teams updated on emerging technologies.

articles.title: Kuwait to host Gulf Red Crescent Conference on AI
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: The first-ever Gulf Red Crescent Conference on Artificial Intelligence will take place on 22nd October, 2025, according to KRCS Chairman Khaled. KUNA reports that the conference will be held in Kuwait Red Crescent Society (KRCS) headquarters.

articles.title: Ai Enters Privacy: 30% of Couples Already Use Chatgpt to Resolve Conflicts
articles.summary: Joan Cwaik, a specialist in emerging technologies, says that 30% of couples use tools like ChatGPT to solve some couple issue. 25% of adults between 20 and 25 years old have already used AI to mediate or seek guidance in partner conflicts.

articles.title: Kaito launches OpenMind Mindshare Leaderboard: CoinLeaders
articles.author: Marina Collins
articles.summary: Kaito AI has officially launched the OpenMind Mindshare Leaderboard. The leaderboard is designed to showcase the most active and influential voices contributing to OpenMind ecosystem. OpenMind is a developer of a decentralized robot operating system. It aims to foster a vibrant community around its technology.

articles.title: Will Campbell: Internet security a steady challenge
articles.author: Will Campbell
articles.summary: The Tribune Content Agency blocked some users from accessing its website on Oct. 11 because of bot traffic. It's a constant task to keep the website secure for a small, local company with fewer resources than a big corporation. The company has about 50,000 to 60,000 page views a day and 2 million requests from confirmed humans per month.

articles.title: How Can AI Companies Make Money?
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has moved from the realm of science fiction into the core of modern business strategy. It's no longer a futuristic concept but a functional technology that is reshaping industries. The mechanics of how companies generate revenue from AI are often less understood than the technical achievements.

articles.title: WhatsApp changes its terms to bar general purpose chatbots from its platform
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: WhatsApp changed its business API policy this week to ban general-purpose chatbots from its platform. The change will go into effect on January 15, 2026. It doesn't affect businesses that are using AI to serve customers on WhatsApp. WhatsApp Business API is designed for businesses serving customers and not for chatbot distribution.

articles.title: Kuwait to host first Gulf Red Crescent Conference on artificial intelligence next Wednesday
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: Kuwait will host the first Gulf Red Crescent Conference on Artificial Intelligence next Wednesday. The conference is a step toward establishing a unified Gulf vision for leveraging AI in humanitarian work and regional cooperation. It will be held in collaboration with the Secretariat General of the Red Crescent.

articles.title: AI headshots are changing the way job seekers are seen and get hired in changing labor market
articles.author: Krysta Escobar
articles.summary: AI headshots are becoming popular on LinkedIn and in professional portfolios as job seekers look for affordable profile pictures to give them an edge. The average starting cost for a professional headshot in the U.S. can easily run up to hundreds of dollars. Canva recently launched its own AI headshot feature with the goal of offering users a quick way to create realistic headshots.

articles.title: This Week's Awesome Tech Stories From Around the Web (Through October 18)
articles.author: Singularityhub Staff
articles.summary: MIT has developed a technique that allows language models to improve themselves. 95% of kids with Bubble Boy disease were cured by one-time gene therapy. California is the first state to regulate AI companion chatbots. Nvidia is taking orders for the DGX Spark, a $4,000 desktop AI computer.

articles.title: Science fiction sold us 'good' AI â€“ now it's shaping how we treat real AI
articles.summary: By filling our minds with loyal droids and wise computers, sci-fi has set us up to misunderstand the messy truth of AI, writes Andrew Keen. He asks if we are prepared to accept AI's imperfections and its limitations. He also asks whether we are ready to accept its benefits.

articles.title: San Jose employees, meet your new chatbot assistant? City eyes expansion of AI
articles.author: The Mercury News
articles.summary: The 311 Service Request Analyzer identifies the top 10 issues residents are submitting. San Jose's leaders want to expand AI use to boost productivity throughout the workforce by using a tool that would allow all of its 7,000 employees to create their own chatbot assistants.

articles.title: Kuwait to host the first Gulf Red Crescent Conference on Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: The Peninsula
articles.summary: The first Gulf Red Crescent Conference on Artificial Intelligence will be held in Kuwait on 22-23 October, 2025. The conference marks the first step toward establishing a unified Gulf vision for leveraging AI in humanitarian work and regional cooperation. The two-day conference will focus on Harnessing the Power of Artificial Intelligence.

articles.title: Prankster Traps 50 Waymo Self-Driving Cars in Dead End
articles.author: Simran Rastogi
articles.summary: Riley Walz, 23, organized 50 people to order Waymo self-driving cars to San Francisco's longest dead-end street. He crashed the system with Jaguar I-Paces with Waymo's spinning roof sensors. Nobody got in the cars, so the vehicles left and charged each participant a $5 no-show fee.

articles.title: Will Artificial Intelligence Become a Commodity?
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is becoming a commodity. The commoditization of core AI means that its power is no longer confined to a few specialties. This doesn't diminish AI's importance, but amplifies it.    .  Â    for the general public.

articles.title: Cyber expert says 'Robo-Cops' are a reality that 'could' happen
articles.summary: Kurt 'CyberGuy' Knutsson joins Fox & Friends Weekend to react to growing talks of using AI-powered robots to help police the streets. He thinks it's a good idea.   Â Kurt is a member of CyberGuy.

articles.title: Avoiding AI Enshittification: Lessons from Tech Platforms
articles.author: Web Pro News
articles.summary: In the rapidly evolving world of artificial intelligence, there is the risk of 'enshittification' which is a term coined by Cory Doctorow to describe how digital platforms degrade over time. Industry experts are questioning whether AI tools can avoid the pitfalls that plagued social media giants.

articles.title: Why This 36-Stock AI ETF Is Poised to Deliver 200% Returns by 2030
articles.author: Matt Frankel
articles.summary: Ark Autonomous Technology and Robotics ETF is an actively managed artificial intelligence (AI) fund. It has beaten the "Magnificent Seven" in 2025 and could keep outperforming in the future. The fund has a 0.75% management fee. It's cheaper than an S&P 500 index fund, but it's more volatile.

articles.title: Without Speculation There Are No Trains
articles.summary: OpenAI will invest US$1 trillion in data centers and other things necessary for artificial intelligence in the next few years. US$ 300 billion of that was awarded to Oracle, but OpenAI has no way of paying anything like that. Nvidia will invest $100 billion in OpenAI in exchange for Oracle buying Nvidia chips.

articles.title: IonQ: Is It Too Late to Buy After Its 1,200% Gain?
articles.author: Adria Cimino
articles.summary: IonQ (NYSE: IONQ) has gained more than 1,200% in the past three years. IonQ sells quantum hardware and networking products and consulting services. The company wants to become the "Nigra of quantum computing". IonQ's revenue has advanced over the past few years, but the company's losses have deepened.

articles.title: The platform exposing exactly how much copyrighted art is used by AI tools
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: Vermilio claims it can trace percentage of AI-generated image from pre-existing material from 007 to Elsa using its AI-powered software. It claims to be able to do this even if it doesn't have all the necessary data.

articles.title: Sex Is Big Market for AI Industry
articles.author: Matt O'Brien
articles.summary: ChatGPT will soon engage in "erotica for verified adults". CEO Sam Altman says the company aims to allow more user freedom for adults while setting limits for teens.    i.e. it will allow more freedom for the adults and limit the freedom of the teens.

articles.title: AI Servers Drive Super Micro's Surge, But Analysts Urge Caution
articles.author: IMP
articles.summary: Despite lingering concerns, Wall Street sees AI hardware growth as a strong tailwind for Super Micro Computer's future. Analysts warn against overreacting to AI servers, however.   Â IMPONSIUM is an online news service. It is published by IMP.

articles.title: Senior Software Engineer for Microsoft Teams AI Platform: Content Writing Role Overview
articles.summary: Microsoft is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to build the foundation for its Teams AI Platform. The position involves developing the infrastructure capable of supporting AI agents across Teams' interaction channels-chats, channels, and meetings. Expertise in Azure, Distributed Systems and backend development is essential. Microsoft's commitment to AI extends beyond Teams, with notable investments in Azure OpenAI Service and Azure AI Studio.

articles.title: 3 Practical Uses for ChatGPT
articles.author: Matt Jancer
articles.summary: ChatGPT is the Uber or Netflix of generative AI. Google Gemini, Anthropic Claude, and Perplexity AI are also useful chatbots. They can be helpful in diagnosing and fixing problems. They help with home surround sound system troubles, printer problems and houseplant problems.

articles.title: What the dot-com bubble can teach investors worried about an AI burst
articles.author: Star Tribune
articles.summary: There are several lessons learned from the tech bubble of the late 1990s that can help guide us through the uncertainty ahead when it comes to artificial intelligence.  iReport.com: What are some of the lessons from the recent tech bubble that can guide us in the future?

articles.title: The last few months have been devastating for LLM dreams
articles.author: Gary Marcus
articles.summary: In the last few months, dreams of LLMs bringing us to the cusp of AGI have fallen apart. Even with 'reasoning', LLMs still can't solve distribution shift. Andrej Karpathy, who once ran AI for Tesla and twice worked for OpenAI, said agents aren't anywhere close to AGI and that AGI is a decade away.

articles.title: Michael Mann Says He Might Experiment With AI in â€˜Heat 2:' â€˜Aging and De-Aging May ...
articles.author: Variety
articles.summary: Michael Mann is agnostic about artificial intelligence, but he will make a film about it in the future, if he gets the go-ahead from the director's board. He will probably make a movie about AI, though.    i.e. "The Godfather".

articles.title: Two excellence networks for AI, semiconductor trainingÂ launched in HCM City
articles.author: Vietnam News
articles.summary: Two new networks of training centres of excellence and talent in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and the Semiconductor Industry for the southern region were officially launched on Saturday (October 18) in HCM City. The initiative aims to develop excellence â€“ and talent-oriented training programmes and build leading R&D centres in AI and semiconductors.

articles.title: There's one key thing companies must do when they bring AI into the workplace, BCG's AI ethics officer says
articles.summary: Boston Consulting Group's research shows most employees want roughly five hours of hands-on training. Steven Mills, Chief AI Ethics Officer at BCG, works with governments worldwide. He believes the growing adoption of AI in the private sector is pushing public officials to do the same.

articles.title: There's one key thing companies must do when they bring AI into the workplace, BCG's AI ethics officer says
articles.author: Brent D. Griffiths
articles.summary: Only 5% of companies are deriving value from AI, according to Boston Consulting Group Global Chief AI Ethics Officer Steven Mills. The growing adoption of AI in the private sector is pushing public officials to do the same. OpenAI, partners with BCG, Anthropic, Meta, Google, and Microsoft, have offered their AI agents at almost no cost to federal agencies.

articles.title: There's one key thing companies must do when they bring AI into the workplace, BCG's AI ethics officer says
articles.author: Business Insider
articles.summary: BCG Global Chief AI Ethics Officer Steven Mills says most employees want 5 hours of AI training. Once they learn the basics, the real value begins, he says.    "Companies that want to successfully deploy AI can't just throw workers into the deep end."

articles.title: We just made cleveland.com's search box a lot smarter: Letter from the Editor
articles.author: Chris Quinn
articles.summary: Cleveland.com has added an artificial intelligence to its search function. Jeff Hobbs is director of product management for Advance Local, the parent company of the website. He was a guest on a podcast Can You Hear Me, talking about the use of artificial intelligence in the digital era.

articles.title: San Jose employees, meet your new chatbot assistant? City eyes expansion of AI
articles.author: Devan Patel
articles.summary: The city of San Jose is looking for a chatbot assistant for all of its 7,000 employees. It wants to expand AI use to boost productivity throughout the workforce. The city has already used AI to improve productivity and reduce time spent on repetitive and administrative tasks. It also uses AI to identify potholes, graffiti, illegal dumping and homeless encampments.

articles.title: My Greener Future: AI and customer service
articles.author: William Kaufmann
articles.summary: Half of companies using AI in place of human customer service reps will change their plans by 2027. There will be fewer human agents in the short-term, but the complexity of transactions and the desire for more personalized attention by customers will demand human agents. Human agents can induce customers to upsell or provide them with guidance toward another product or service.

articles.title: My Greener Future: AI and customer service
articles.author: William Kaufmann
articles.summary: According to Garntner, over the short-term, there will be fewer human agents because of automation, but the complexity of transactions and the desire for more personalized attention by customers will demand human agents in the future. The goal should be the most effective customer service program designed for each individual business.

articles.title: The future I saw through the Meta Ray-Ban Display amazes and terrifies me
articles.author: Victoria Song
articles.summary: The Meta Ray-Ban Display smart glasses cost $799. It has a display in the right lens that you can use for basic tasks like glancing at a map or reading a text message. It's not always perfect, but it's useful in one-on-one conversations in a noisy restaurant.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence learns to drive: MarioKart
articles.author: Baltimore Sun
articles.summary: Professor Mumu Xu and her students trained an artificial intelligence model to play the 1992 Nintendo hit Mario Kart as a way to test the algorithms of medical devices and smart gadgets.   Â    i.e. a medical device or a gadget like Amazon Echo.

articles.title: Meta adds parental controls for interactions with AI chatbots
articles.author: Barbara Ortutay
articles.summary: Meta will add parental controls for kids' interactions with artificial intelligence chatbots early next year. It will include the ability to turn off one-on-one chats with AI characters altogether, and turn off AI characters' conversations with other people altogether.

articles.title: Google Launches Sources Column in AI Max for Ad Traffic Insights
articles.author: Web Pro News
articles.summary: Google has introduced a new 'Sources' column in its AI Max search term reports. The update aims to demystify the often opaque world of AI-driven ad matching by revealing the origins of traffic that triggers ads. Advertisers had been frustrated by the black-box nature of automated systems.

articles.title: Proceed with caution when giving generative AI the reins, warns top strategist
articles.author: Luke Daniel
articles.summary: Dr Irina Mirkina is the chief AI scientist at Fugro and an expert for the European Commission Research Executive Agency. She is concerned about the overpromising of AI-model vendors. She proposes a controversial solution to the problem of AI models that overpromise without consequence. The solution places the burden of responsibility on the vendors in the form of financial penalties.

articles.title: Google Offers Greek University Students Free Access to Advanced AI Tools
articles.author: Greek City Times
articles.summary: Google is offering Greek university students free access to its advanced AI tools, including Gemini 2.5 Pro, including AI tools for Gemini 2,5 Pro and AI-related software.   Â    .   in Google's offer to Greek students.

articles.summary: Tech Titans Chase the Holy Grail of AGI. OpenAI's ChatGPT and GPT-4 brought that distant dream closer to mainstream plausibility in 2023. Now in late 2025, the world's largest tech companies are locked in an 'unprecedented' arms race, spending hundreds of billions of dollars.

articles.title: Microsoft: Countries increase use of AI to deceive
articles.author: David Klepper
articles.summary: Russia, China, Iran and North Korea are using artificial intelligence to deceive people online and mount cyberattacks against the United States, according to new research from Microsoft. Microsoft's headquarters is in Redmond, Washington.   .    ...   and

articles.title: Two People Almost Drown After Asking ChatGPT When Low Tide Was
articles.author: Victor Tangermann
articles.summary: The owner of a restaurant in South Wales warned swimmers to turn back from Sully island before the tide came back in. The area has the second-highest tidal range in the world, at roughly 50 feet. The narrow causeway to Sully Island can see tides rising at up to eight miles per hour.

articles.title: AI-Enhanced Multimodal Care for Pancreatic Cancer
articles.summary: The RELEVIUM project launches a multicenter randomized controlled trial focused on the integration of digital technology and artificial intelligence to enhance the quality of life for patients with advanced pancreatic cancer. The project spans cancer centers in Estonia, Israel and Germany. It investigates a novel multimodal supportive care.

articles.title: Generative Artificial Intelligence: a threat, an opportunity or both? (Opinion)
articles.author: Mary Ann Paliani
articles.summary: Generative AI is a subset of AI that enables people to create content based on patterns it has learned. Mary Ann Paliani took a 5-day generative AI course offered by the University of Colorado on ZOOM. She was able to create a lip-synching video of herself reciting a few lines from an essay written in English and a magazine cover for the AARP Magazine using Microsoft's chatbot.

articles.title: Ai in Classrooms: Artificial Intelligence at the Service of Teachers
articles.author: Noticias De Navarra

articles.title: Blackstone says Wall Street is complacent about AI disruption
articles.author: Arash Massoudi
articles.summary: Wall Street investors are underestimating artificial intelligence's potential to make entire industries obsolete, according to Blackstone's president. Jessica Bartnick, CEO of Foundation for C.H.I.E. believes AI is dangerous because it provides easy access to shortcuts and tempts learners to cheat. Nari Jeter, a therapist and mother of two, is concerned that AI may help students tackle more complex problems.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used more and more in schools across the country. Carey Exempted Village Schools in Ohio is taking a proactive approach to integrate AI into daily instruction. The district's push to implement AI is spearheaded by Principal Peter Cole and Director of Technology Brooks Spiess. They advise teachers to start with a few AI tools and let the kids use them first.

articles.title: Sylvester Cancer Tip Sheet For October 2025
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Women living near Superfund sites are more likely to develop aggressive breast cancer. Sylvester researchers will co-lead a $16 million clinical trial to evaluate whether artificial intelligence can help support radiologists in interpreting mammograms more accurately. The study will involve hundreds of thousands of mammograms interpreted at medical centers and breast imaging facilities in California, Florida, Massachusetts, Washington and Wisconsin.

articles.title: AI researcher Andrej Karpathy says agentic AI is years away from matching industry hype
articles.summary: Andrej Karpathy, former AI researcher at OpenAI and Tesla, is skeptical of the current hype surrounding agent-based AI and large language models. He believes AI is still years away from matching industry hype.   The Decoder is a news website.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence learns to drive: MarioKart
articles.author: Karl Hille
articles.summary: Professor Mumu Xu and her students trained an artificial intelligence model to play the 1992 Nintendo hit Mario Kart as a way to study how self-driving cars and robots can be taught to make safe decisions in changing environments in order to improve their performance in the real world.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence learns to drive: MarioKart
articles.summary: University of Maryland professor Mumu Xu and her students trained an artificial intelligence model to play the 1992 Nintendo hit Mario Kart as a way to study how self-driving cars and other robots can be taught to make safe decisions in changing environments. Their research was funded by the U.S. Naval Air Warfare Center Aircraft Division.

articles.title: ChatGPT Coming To Walmart: New AI Shopping Feature Announced
articles.author: Carrie Cabral
articles.summary: Users will be able to 'just chat and buy' and allow the store to handle the rest. articles.title: Wikipedia Seems Pretty Worried About AI

articles.summary: According to Marshall Miller, the rise of chatbots and the AI-ification of Google Search has left Wikipedia with fewer visitors than before. Wikipedia was founded as a stand-alone reference resource before settling ambivalently into a new role: a site that people mostly just find through Google.

articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Meta is rolling out an opt-in feature that allows Facebook users in the US and Canada to edit their unshared photos and upload them to Meta's cloud. Facebook's AI will scan your phone's camera roll, identifying photos and videos you haven't already posted. It will then suggest edits and collages, aiming to transform those 'lost among screenshots, receipts, and random snaps' moments into social media gold. Meta insists its data won't be used for ad targeting, but the implications are far-reaching.

articles.title: What AI Will Be Like A Year From Now
articles.author: Eli Amdur

articles.title: UW Health testing AI technology for breast cancer detection
articles.author: Ashley Weil
articles.summary: UW Health is taking part in the PRISM Trial (Pragmatic Randomized Trial of Artificial Intelligence for Screening Mammography). It's the first randomized controlled trial for AI mammography in the United States. 50,000 women in Wisconsin will take part over the next two years. Half of them will have an FDA-approved AI tool assist a radiologist in analyzing the data, while the other half will go through routine screening without the AI tool. The goal is to catch cancer earlier and save lives.

articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Nano Banana is Google's new AI imaging tool. It's being integrated into Google Messages. Code from a recent version of Google Messages points to the introduction of Nano Banana functionality to the messaging app. Android Authority reports that it was able to display a placeholder for Nano Banana.

articles.title: Zini: Revolutionizing Healthcare with AI-Driven Content Writing Solutions
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: AI-Powered Virtual Physician ZINI Launched to Democratize Healthcare Access in India. It is an AI-powered virtual physician that provides preliminary medical guidance and connects patients with qualified doctors. It supports Hindi, Punjabi, Bangla, and English.

articles.title: JPMorgan estimates 30 AI stocks have made Americans $5 trillion richer in the last year
articles.author: Samuel O'Brient
articles.summary: JPMorgan estimates that a group of 30 AI-linked companies have generated $5 trillion for investors in the last year. The list of winning AI stocks includes Nvidia and Microsoft. The bank is bullish on AI stocks, though a correction in the sector would erase a considerable portion of recent wealth gains.

articles.title: U.S. Army General Says He Embraces AI to 'Enhance' Decision-Making
articles.author: Breitbart
articles.summary: U.S. Army Major General William "Hank" Taylor has revealed his close collaboration with AI chatbots to sharpen his skills. He uses them to help him improve his judgement and judgemental capabilities. He also uses them as a tool to improve his mental state.

articles.title: Facebook's new button lets its AI look at photos you haven't uploaded yet
articles.author: Elissa Welle
articles.summary: Meta has rolled out an opt-in AI feature to its US and Canadian Facebook users that claims to make their photos and videos more 'shareworthy'. If you opt in, Meta's AI will comb through your camera roll and upload your unpublished photos to Meta's cloud and surface 'hidden gems' that are lost among screenshots, receipts, and random snaps. Users will be able to save or share the suggested edits and collages.

articles.summary: ChatGPT will soon engage in "erotica for verified adults" according to CEO Sam Altman. This move could help OpenAI, which is losing money, turn a profit. Experts express concerns about the impact on real-world relationships and the potential for misuse.

articles.title: Internal documents suggest Salesforce offered AI services to expand Donald Trump's immigration crackdown
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Salesforce pitched the use of its artificial intelligence capabilities to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to assist the agency in staffing up for expanded immigration raids and deportations across the U.S., according to internal company documents obtained by The New York Times.

articles.title: AI says the King is right on architecture
articles.author: AOL

He made the remarks at the opening of the conference "University and Artificial Intelligence" in Amman on Saturday.

articles.title: Sora 2 and ChatGPT are consuming so much power that OpenAI just did another 10 gigawatt deal
articles.author: Lisa Eadicicco
articles.summary: OpenAI is partnering with Broadcom to design and develop 10 gigawatts of custom AI chips and systems. Deployment of the AI accelerator and network systems is expected to start in the second half of 2026. Broadcom shares soared 12% on Monday morning following the announcement.
